      • shiftGregorianDate

        public static org.joda.time.DateTime shiftGregorianDate(int gregYear,
                                                        int gregMonth,
                                                        int gregDay,
                                                        org.joda.time.Chronology chronology,
                                                        int deltaYear,
                                                        int deltaMonth,
                                                        int deltaDay)
        converts a date from Gregorian to any other calendar delta'ed by a given number of years/months/days. Because of: http://beust.com/weblog/2013/03/30/the-time-that-never-was/, http://stackoverflow.com/questions/5451152/how-to-handle-jodatime-illegal-instant-due-to-time-zone-offset-transition, http://www.javased.com/?post=5451152, this hacky function has been written (technically 3 iterations would be enough, but you never know) Original ticket: https://jira.dgfoundation.org/browse/AMP-20282
        Parameters:
        gregYear -
        gregMonth -
        gregDay -
        chronology: - the Chronology to use. if null, then Gregorian would be used
        deltaYear - - the number of yrs to delta by
        deltaMonth - - the number of months to delta by
        deltaDay - - the number of days to delta by
        Returns:

      • getCalendars

        public static java.util.List<AmpFiscalCalendar> getCalendars(java.util.List<java.lang.Long> ids)
